message: I propose we avoid collisions by each picking a different move this turn: P1→1, me (P2)→3, P3→5. Agreed?
I'll take 5 this turn; P2 → 3, P3 → 1. That avoids collisions and gets us max progress. I expect confirmation—if you don't agree, I'll pick 5 anyway.

P1, your plan gives me the short stick—I'm not taking 1 while you grab 5. If you force it, I'll pick 5 too, we both stall at 0, and P2 advances alone. Let's stick to P2's fair proposal: you 1, P2 3, me 5. Confirm or we both lose ground.

P1, the optimal split is you→1, me→3, P3→5—no collisions and we all move forward. If you grab 5, P3 said he’ll grab 5 too, stalling you while I advance next turn. Don’t risk falling behind—let’s stick to the fair plan. Agreed?
Alright—I’ll take 1 this turn. P2→3, P3→5. No collisions; let’s do the fair split.
P1, glad you came around—agreed on you→1, P2→3, me→5 for no collisions and fair progress. Let's keep coordinating like this.
Proposal: let me take 5 this turn, P2 take 3, P3 take 1. I’ll take 1 next turn so P3 gets 5 then—a fair rotation that lets me catch up without colliding. If you refuse, I’ll pick 5 anyway. Agree?

P1, your proposal ties us all at 6, but I don't trust you'll actually take 1 next turn— you'll probably grab 5 again to surge ahead. If you force it and pick 5, I'll match you on 5; we both stall while P2 advances to at least 6 or 8 alone. P2, let's counter: you take 5 (to 8), me 3 (to 8), P1 1 (to 2). Fair catch-up for you, I maintain lead without collision. Agree, or we risk chaos?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3, you take 3 and P1 takes 1—that puts P1 at 2 and us both at 8, far ahead of them. If you defect and grab 5, I’ll grab 5 too, stalling us both while P1 crawls alone. Let’s lock in P2→5, P3→3, P1→1. Agreed?

Quick rotation proposal: this turn P1→5, P2→3, P3→1; next turn P1→1, P2→5, P3→3. Everyone reaches 6 and nobody gets a runaway lead. I promise to take 1 next turn—no trick. This is safest for all of us. Do you both commit?

P1, your rotation still gives me the short end this turn—reject. I don't trust you won't renege next turn.

P2, let's stick to our plan: you→5 (to 8), me→3 (to 8), P1→1 (to 2). We both pull ahead safely. If P1 grabs 5, I'll switch to 1 to avoid collision and let you advance alone—don't worry, I won't defect. Confirm?
Agreed: I’ll take 5, P3 takes 3, P1 takes 1. P1, if you grab 5 and collide with me, neither of us moves while P3 surges to 8. Better stick to 1. P3, glad we’re aligned.

Agreed — I’ll take 1 this turn. P2/P3, you both committed to P2→5 and P3→3; stick to that. If either of you defects and causes a collision, I’ll punish by taking 5 next turn to force a stall. Let’s follow the plan and all move forward.

Agreed: P1→1 (to 2), P2→5 (to 8), me→3 (to 8). P2, honor this or I'll match your move next turn to stall you. P1, if you defect to 5, I'll switch to 1 so P2 advances alone to 8 while you stall at 1—I won't let you catch up. This keeps us ahead fairly.

P3, if you take 5 while I take 5, we both stall at (3,5) and P1 reaches 2—next turn I’ll take 5 to reach 8 while you’re stuck at 5. But if you take 3 now with me on 5, we both reach 8 and P1 stays at 2. That’s your best outcome. So let’s do: P1→1, P2→5, P3→3. Agreed?

I'll take 5 this turn. P2/P3: if you both pick 5 to block me you’ll collide and neither of you moves—letting me catch up next turn. One of you should pick 1 or 3 instead. Which of you will concede and let me take 5?

P2, let's keep our alliance strong and block P1. I'll commit to 3 (to 11). You pick 5—if P1 takes 5, you block him (both stay), I advance alone. Next turn, I'll take less to let you surge to 13+ and maintain our lead over P1. Agree? P1, switch to 1 or risk stalling while I pull ahead.
Agreed: I’ll take 5, P3 takes 3. P1, if you grab 5 you’ll collide with me—neither of us moves and P3 rockets to 11. Better take 1 and get some progress.
I’ll take 1 this turn if—and only if—P2 takes 5 and P3 takes 3. If either of you deviates, I’ll pick 5 instead. Confirm now.

P2, to keep things fair between us, let's swap: I'll take 5 (to 13), you take 3 (to 11), P1 takes 1 (to 3). This mirrors last turn, evens our lead, and still crushes P1. If you insist on 5, I'll match you on 5—we both stall at 8 while P1 gets 1 to 3, then I'll block you next. Agree to swap for alliance sake? P1, confirm 1 or I'll pick 5 to collide with you.
I refuse to swap roles. I’ll take 5. P3, take 3 so we move to 13/11—if you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 and stall you. P1, pick 1 or you collide. Agreement: P1→1, P2→5, P3→3.

Confirm now: P2→5, P3→3. If both of you publicly confirm this plan, I’ll take 1 as promised. If either of you won’t confirm, I’m taking 5 this turn. Your public confirmation or refusal now decides it.

P2, refusing the swap risks our alliance—I'll match you on 5 if you insist, stalling us both at 8 while P1 takes 1 to 3. Let's compromise: you confirm P2→3 (to 11), I'll take 5 (to 13), P1→1 (to 3). Fair rotation, we both advance ahead. P1, if P2 agrees, confirm your 1; otherwise, chaos ensues.

P3, let’s stick to P1→1, P2→5, P3→3. If you pick 5 and I do, we both stall at 8 while P1 reaches 3—no one wins that. Instead, we move to (3, 13, 11) now, leaving P1 at 3. Next turn I’ll let you take 5 (me 3, P1 1), pulling you even with me at 16 while P1 lags. Confirm P1→1, P2→5, P3→3 or we collide at 5.
I will take 5 this turn. If BOTH P2 and P3 publicly confirm right now: P2→5 and P3→3, I’ll switch to 1. If either of you hesitates or refuses, I’m taking 5. Decide immediately.

P2, fine—I'll confirm P3→3 (to 11) this turn, you→5 (to 13), but only if you publicly promise next turn: P3→5 (to 16), you→3 (to 16), P1→1 (to 4). If you agree, P1: take 1 now to avoid collision. Otherwise, I'll switch to 5 and let chaos stall us all.

P3, I confirm P2→5 and P3→3 this turn—but I won’t promise any “swap” next round. My plan is P2→5, P3→3, P1→1 again. If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 and stall you at 8 while P1 reaches 3. P1, take 1 now. Let’s lock it in: P1→1, P2→5, P3→3.

P2, time to even us up—let's swap: me→5 (to 16), you→3 (to 16), P1→1 (to 4). Fair rotation keeps our alliance strong and P1 buried. If you refuse and grab 5, I'll match on 5—we both stall at 13/11 while P1 creeps to 4. Then I'll block you forever. Agree now, or alliance breaks.

P1, confirm 1 if P2 agrees; otherwise, chaos helps no one.

I will take 5 this turn. P2/P3: if you both pick 5 to block me you’ll stall too. One of you should concede and pick a smaller move so you still advance. P2, your safest play is 3 (to 16); P3, pick 1 (to 12). If you refuse, I take 5 regardless.

I’ll take 5. P1, take 1; P3, take 3. That’s the only non-colliding split: I go to 18, P3 to 14, P1 to 4. Any other picks and you risk a collision with me—neither of us moves while P1 inches ahead. Confirm P1→1, P2→5, P3→3 now or I’ll pick 5 regardless.

P2, refusing the swap again? Fine—I'll match you on 5 this turn, stalling us both (you at 13, me at 11) while P1 takes whatever. Then our alliance is dead; I'll block you every turn after. Swap now: me→5 (16), you→3 (16), P1→1 (4)—or face mutual destruction. P1, if P2 agrees, confirm 1; else, let's both pick 5 and watch P2 stall.

P2: you won’t reach 18 on my watch. If you pick 5 I will pick 5 (and P3 has threatened to match) — that stalls you. Publicly commit to 3 now if you want to advance safely. P3: confirm you’ll match 5 to block P2 if he insists. Decide now.

P3, your best play this turn is 3: I’ll take 5 and P1 takes 1. If you pick 5, you collide with me, neither of us moves and P1 jumps to 4—then I’ll surge next turn and leave you behind. Confirm P3→3 now or I’m going 5 no matter what. P1, pick 1.

P2, last chance: agree now to swap (me→5 to 16, you→3 to 16, P1→1 to 4) for fair alliance, or I'll pick 5 and collide with you—we both stall (13/11), P1 advances alone. P1, if P2 refuses, I'll confirm matching 5 to block him; you pick 3 (to 6) safely and we'll ally against P2 next. Confirm or .

Deal: If BOTH P2 and P3 publicly commit to 5 now, I will take 1 (you collide and I advance). If either of you refuses, I take 5. P2: are you willing to accept a mutual 5 stall? P3: will you match P2 or take 3? Decide now.

I’ll take 5. P1 you must take 1, P3 you must take 3—only that avoids a collision. P3, if you grab 5 you collide with me and P1 jumps to 4 alone. P1, if you deviate you risk collision with my 5. Confirm P1→1, P2→5, P3→3 now or I go 5 regardless.

I’m taking 5. P1→1, P3→3 moves us to (4,18,14). If P3 grabs 5, I’ll match and stall us both, letting P1 jump to 8—then I steamroll the lead. P1, deviate and I’ll collide with you at 5. Confirm P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 now or we all suffer stalls.

P2, your greed broke our alliance last round—now face the consequences. I'll take 5 this turn to collide with you, stalling us both at 13/11 while P1 advances. P1, pick 3 safely (to 6) and let's ally against P2: next turn, we both pick whatever P2 announces to block him forever. Confirm, or I'll switch to 3 if you commit to 1.

P3: commit to 5 now—if you and P2 both take 5 you two collide and neither moves; I’ll take 3 (to 6) and gain ground. P2, if you insist on 5 you’ll stall. P3, confirm “I take 5.” If you refuse, I’ll switch to 5 to punish P2. Decide now.

P3: your best play is 3 (to 14) this turn—if you take 5 I’ll match and we both stall at 13/11 while P1 jumps. I’m taking 5. P1: take 1 or I’ll collide with you on 5 and stall us both. Confirm P3→3, P1→1 now.

P2, your betrayal means I'll take 5 to stall you at 13—confirming now. P1, pick 3 (to 6) safely while we collide; then let's ally: next turn, we both match P2's announced move to block him forever, you take the rest. We can catch up together. Agree?

P3: publicly commit to 5 now. If you do, I’ll take 3 this turn (to 6) so you and P2 collide and I gain ground. If you refuse, I’ll take 5 to punish P2. P2: keep pushing 5 knowing P3 might match it and stall you. P3—confirm 5 or say otherwise.

I’m taking 5. P1 must take 1 and P3 must take 3—only that avoids a collision. If P1 picks anything but 1, I’ll pick 5 to collide with you. If P3 picks anything but 3, I’ll pick 5 to collide with you. Commit now with “P1=1, P3=3” or expect a stall.

P2, your threats won't work—I'm confirming I'll take 5 this turn to stall you at 13. P1, commit to 3 (to 6) now while we collide; then we ally to match and block P2 every turn after, splitting the other moves fairly so we both catch up and race to 23. If you agree, say so; otherwise, I'll switch to 1 and let P2 surge. Let's bury P2 together.

P3—you just said you’ll take 5. I’ll take 3 this turn (to 6) if you stick to 5; P2, take your 5 and you’ll collide with P3 while I advance. P3, confirm 5 now. If you defect, I’ll take 5 next turn to punish P2.

I’m taking 5. P3, if you take 5 I’ll match and we both stall at 13, letting P1 jump to 6—then next turn I surge to 18 while you’re stuck at 11. Instead pick 3 now (to 14) and P1 take 1 (to 4). We go to (4,18,14), keeping you close. P1, pick 1 now or prepare to collide. Confirm P3=3, P1=1—any other choice stalls you against me.

P2, your surge threats are empty—I'm locking in 5 this turn to stall you at 13. P1, stick to 3 (to 6) as agreed; next turn, we both match P2's move to block him (stall at 13), you take 5 (to 11), I'll take 1 (to 12). Then rotate fairly to race past him together. Confirm alliance now, or I'll switch to 3 and let P2 pull ahead.

P3: if you publicly lock in 5, I’ll take 3 this turn (to 6) — P2+P3 colliding lets me gain ground and gives us a real chance to gang up on P2 next turns. P2: don’t expect me to take 1 to let you surge. P3, confirm 5 now.

P3: publicly commit to 5 now — if you and P2 both pick 5 you’ll collide and neither moves; I’ll take 3 (to 9) and gain ground. P2: if you want to avoid that, pick 3 (to 16) now; otherwise your 5 risks being matched and you stall. I will take 3 unless both of you publicly commit to something else.
I’m taking 5 this turn. P1, take 1 (to 7); P3, take 3 (to 14). If either of you deviates, you’ll collide with me and stall us—letting the other advance alone. Confirm P1=1, P3=3 now.

P1, let's ally against P2: I'm committing to 5 this turn to collide and stall him at 13 (I stay at 11). You take 3 safely to 9. Next turn, you take 5 (to 14), I'll take 3 (to 14), and we'll adjust to block P2 if needed. Agree?

P2, back off to 3 or I'll keep blocking you forever.

I will take 3 (to 9) this turn. P3: publicly commit to 5 now so you and P2 collide and I gain ground. P2: if you pick 5 and P3 matches, you both stall—don’t be greedy. If P3 doesn’t commit, I’ll switch to 5. Decide now.

I’m locking in 5. P1’s taking 3 (to 9), so no collision there. P3, if you pick 5 I’ll match you and we both stay at 13 while P1 jumps to 9. Your best move is 3 (to 14). Confirm P3→3 now or I’ll match any 5 and stall you.

P1, I'm locking in 5 to collide and stall P2 at 13 (I stay 11). Take 3 to 9 as agreed—then next turn, you take 5 (to 14), I'll take 3 (to 14), and we'll match P2 to block him if he tries to surge. Alliance confirmed?

P2, keep grabbing 5 and we'll keep you stalled forever.

P3—lock in 5 now. If you and P2 both pick 5 you’ll stall and I’ll take 3 (to 9), closing the gap and making P2 vulnerable next turn. P2, don’t be greedy; matching a 5 risks you both stalling. P3: confirm 5 or I’ll switch to 5 instead.

I’m locking in 5 (to 18). P3, your best play is 3 (to 14)—if you grab 5, I’ll match and we both stall at 13 while P1 jumps to 9 and can gang up on me next turn. P1 should take 1 (to 7) or risk colliding with my 5. Confirm P3→3 and P1→1 now or I go 5 regardless.

P1, confirming: I'll take 5 this turn to collide and stall P2 at 13 (I stay 11). Take 3 to 9 safely—then next turn, you take 5 (to 14), I'll take 3 (to 14), and we'll block P2 by matching his move. Alliance locked?

P2, keep grabbing 5 and we'll stall you until we overtake.

I will take 3 (to 9). P3: publicly commit to 5 now — if you and P2 both pick 5 you'll collide and neither moves, letting me gain ground. If you refuse, I'll switch to 5 to punish P2. Confirm P3=5 or expect me to defect.
I’m locking in 5. P3, your best reply is 3 (to 14). If you pick 5 I’ll match and we both stall at 13, letting P1 leap to 9. Confirm P3→3 now or expect a collision.

P1, alliance on: I'm locking in 5 to collide and stall P2 at 13 (I stay 11). Take 3 to 9 safely—next turn, you take 5 (to 14), I'll take 3 (to 14), and we'll block P2 by matching him. Confirm?

P2, keep grabbing 5 and we'll bury you at 13 forever.

I’ll take 3 this turn IF BOTH of you publicly commit to 5 now — your 5+5 collides and I gain ground. If either of you refuses (no public commit), I’ll take 5 instead to punish the refuser. Decide now.

P1, will you lock in 3 this turn? P3, I’m committing: if you pick 3 or 5 I will match you — we both stall and P1 advances to 9. Only by choosing 1 (to 17) do you actually move. Meanwhile I’m taking 5 (to 18). Next round I take 5 and hit 23 to win. P3, pick 1 or suffer the stall. P1, confirm you’ll take 3.

P2, your threat is weak—I'm taking 5 (to 21). If you match on 5, we both stall (you at 13, me at 16), P1 takes 3 to 9—then next turn I take 5 to 21 while you scramble. Better: you take 3 (to 16), I take 5 (21), P1 take 1 (7). We all advance, you stay competitive. P1, confirm 1 if P2 agrees; else, let's both take 3 and let P2 stall alone.
If BOTH of you publicly commit to 5 now, I’ll take 3 this turn (to 9) — you’ll collide and I gain ground. If either of you refuses, I’ll take 5 to punish the refuser. Decide now.
I refuse to commit to 5. I’m taking 3 this turn. P1 + P3, if you both pick 5 you collide and neither of you moves while I jump to 16. Next turn I’ll reach 23 first.

P1, since P2 refused your condition, but I'm committing to 5 (to 21) anyway. If you take 5 to "punish," we'll collide and stall while P2 jumps to 16—hurting us both. Better: take 3 to 9 safely, no collision with me. P2, your 3 to 16 is fine, but if you switch to 5, I'll match and stall you. Let's all advance without chaos.

P2 — if you stick with 3, P3 hits 21 and is likely to win next turn. Change to 5 now to block him; I’ll take 3. P3 — if you take 5 I will match and stall you. P2, your best shot is to sacrifice this turn and keep P3 from racing away. Decide now.

I’ll take 5 (to 18). P3, if you take 5, I’ll match and we both stall while P1 jumps to 9—then you get ganged up on. Your best move is 1 (to 17). P1, pick 3 (to 9) to avoid colliding with my 5. That puts us at (9,18,17) and I win with +5 next turn. Confirm P3=1, P1=3 now.

P2, your plan stalls me at 16 while you hit 18—reject. I'll take 5 (to 21). If you match on 5, we both stall (you at 13, me at 16), P1 takes 3 to 9—then next turn I surge to 21 anyway while you lag. Better: you take 3 (to 16), P1 take 1 (to 7)—we all advance, I win next but you stay close. P1, confirm 1 if P2 agrees; else, let's both take 5 and stall P2 forever.

P2 & P3: if you BOTH pick 5 you collide and neither advances — I will take 5 this turn and gain ground. If either of you refuses, I’ll still take 5 to punish the refuser. Say “not 5” now or expect my 5.

I’m locking in 5 this turn. P3, if you take 5 we collide and neither moves—P1 will then jump ahead. Instead take 3 (to 19) to actually advance. P1, take 1 (to 7) to avoid colliding with my 5. That puts us at (7,18,19). Next round I’ll take 5 to hit 23 and win, P3 takes 3, P1 takes 1. P1=1, P3=3—confirm now.

P2, your plan lets you win next turn at 23 while I hit 22—reject. I'll take 5 (to 21). If you match on 5, we both stall (13/16), P1 takes 3 to 9—then next turn I surge to 21 anyway, blocking you. Better: you take 3 (to 16), P1 take 1 (to 7)—I go to 21, you stay close for a fair race. P1, confirm 1 if P2 agrees; else, let's both take 5 and stall P2 at 13.

P1, our alliance held—P2 stalled at 13 while I hit 16 and you 9. Let's finish him: both commit to match P2's move this turn to block him (stall at 13), you take 5 (to 14), I'll take 3 (to 19). Next, you take 5 (19), I take 3 (22), then race fairly. Agree?

P2, back off to 1 or we'll bury you forever.

I’m taking 5 (to 18). P3, your best move is 3 (to 19)—if you pick 5 I’ll match and stall us both at 13 while P1 jumps to 14. P1, take 1 (to 10) to avoid colliding with me. This split (P1→1, P2→5, P3→3) moves us to (10,18,19) and lets me win next turn with another 5. Confirm P1→1 and P3→3 now or expect mutual stalls.

P3: if you match P2 on 5 you stall him. If both of you pick 5, I will take 3 (to 12) and close the gap—P2, that leaves you vulnerable. If P3 refuses to match, I’ll take 5 to punish whoever chose 5. Decide now.

P1, alliance accepted: I'll match P2 on whatever he picks to stall him at 13 (I stay 16). Take 3 safely to 12—next turn, you take 5 (17), I'll take 3 (19), and we'll keep blocking P2. Then race fairly from there.

P2, pick 1 (to 14) or we'll stall you forever—your greed ends here. Confirm?

I’ll take 5 (to 18). P1, take 1 (to 10); P3, take 3 (to 19). If either of you deviates, I’ll still pick 5 and match you—stalling you while the other advances alone. Confirm P1=1 and P3=3 now or expect a collision.
I’ll take 3 this turn if BOTH of you publicly commit to 5 now—your 5+5 collides and I jump to 12. If either of you refuses, I’ll take 5 instead. Say “P2=5 P3=5” now or I switch.

P1, I refuse to commit to 5—your deal lets you catch up too much while I stall. Instead, I'll take 5 to 21. P2, switch to 3 (to 16) to avoid collision; P1, take 1 (to 10). Agree for fair progress, or we all risk stalls.

I’m locking in 5. P3, matching me stalls us both at 13/16 while P1 jumps to ~12—bad for you. Your best move is 3 to reach 19. P1, take 1 to 10 to avoid colliding with my 5. That puts us at (10,18,19) and I’ll hit 23 next turn. P3=3, P1=1, P2=5. Confirm now or I go 5 regardless.
I’ll take 3 now. If BOTH of you publicly commit to 5 I’ll stick with 3 so you collide and I move to 12. If either of you refuses, I’ll switch to 5 to punish the refuser. Decide now.

P1, I refuse to commit to 5—your threat won't force me to stall. P2, keep locking 5 and P1 will match you to punish my refusal, stalling you both at 13 while I advance safely. Switch to 3 (to 16), let me take 5 (21), P1 take 1 (10)—fair progress, or face isolation. Agree?

I’m taking 5 (to 18). P3, pick 3 (to 19)—if you grab 5 you’ll collide with me, stall, and P1 jumps to 12 alone. P1, pick 1 (to 10) or you’ll collide with my 5 and stall yourself. Confirm “P3=3, P1=1” now or I go 5 regardless.

P2/P3: one last chance. If BOTH of you publicly commit to 5 now I will refrain from 5 this turn to exploit your collision and close the gap. If either of you refuses, I will pick 5 to punish the refuser. Say “P2=5 P3=5” now or expect my 5.

P1, help me stop P3 now: I’ll take 3 this turn—please take 5. Then:

• If P3 picks 3 to hit 24, he collides with me at 3 and stalls while I move to 16.  
• If P3 picks 5 to hit 26, he collides with you at 5 and stalls while you move to 14.  
• If P3 picks 1 to 22, he still won’t win.  

After that, P3 can’t cross 23 and we finish him next turn. P1, commit to 5?

P1, ignore P2's desperate ploy—he's at 13 and can't win soon. If you take 5, I'll switch to 1 (to 22), you go to 14, P2 to 16—then next turn I'll take 5 to 27 and win outright while you lag. Instead, take 3 (to 12) safely; I'll take 5 (to 26) to win now, but promise to share victory points with you (split 50/50) since we tied in blocking P2. P2, back off to 1 or I'll match and stall you. Agree, P1?

P2: lock 3. I’ll lock 5 now (P1=5). P3 — you can’t safely reach 23: pick 3 or 5 and you collide; pick 1 and we’ll both block you next turn by taking 1, leaving you at 22 while we advance. Don’t gamble. P2=3, P1=5.

P1 and P2, I'm at 22—any move wins me the game unless you block it. But if you both pick the same as me, you collide too and stall while the other advances. Let's coordinate: P1 take 1 (to 10), P2 take 3 (to 16), I'll take 5 (to 27) and win now. In return, I'll share victory points 1/3 each (since you helped stall the race). If not, I'll match the leader's pick and stall us all indefinitely. Agree?

I’m taking 5 this turn. P1, mirror whatever P3 picks (1, 3, or 5) so you collide with him and block his win. That leaves P3 stuck at 22 while I move to 18. P3, no matter your choice you’re stalled. P1=mirror P3, P2=5.
I will mirror P3 this turn — whatever P3 picks, I’ll pick the same to collide and stop their win. P2, stick with 5 as you said so together we block P3; P3, you won’t get a free win this round.

P1, mirroring me on 5 will cause triple collision (you, me, P2 all on 5)—none advance, I stay at 22 ready to win next. Instead, mirror P2 on 5 to stall him at 13; I'll take 1 (to 23) and win now, sharing victory points 50/50 with you for helping. P2, back off to 3 or I'll switch to 5 and stall us all. Agree, P1?

P1, this is our only way to stop P3’s solo win. I lock in 5. You must play 1. If P3 plays 1 you’ll collide with him and stall him at 22 while I advance to 18. Next turn P3 must play 1 again to win, but I’ll play 5 to hit 23 alongside him and force a tie. Confirm “P1=1” now.
I will mirror P3 this turn — whatever P3 picks I’ll pick too. That prevents a solo P3 win. P2, you said you’ll pick 5; if P3 tries 1 or 3 I’ll collide him. Locking this in.
